headline: Osun govt mourns ex-DIG, Israel Ajao
summarized_story:
The Osun State Government, on Sunday, commiserated with the family of Mr. Israel Ajao, and the Nigerian Police Force, over the passage of the retired Deputy Inspector-General of Police.
While in the service, Ajao was the pioneer Assistant Inspector-General in charge of the Force Intelligence Unit and also served as the Deputy Inspector-General in charge of Force Criminal Investigations, and later, Operations, before retiring in 2010.
The statement read in parts, “We are also extending our sympathies to the good people of Oluponna in particular and Osun State in general over the demise of one of the state’s finest national icon.
The death of DIG Israel Ajao (retd.)
On behalf of the governor, government, and the people of Osun, we extend our deepest condolences to the family of DIG Israel Ajao (retd).

headline: Three killed, 11 injured in US shooting
summarized_story:
Three people were killed and 11 others injured on Saturday after multiple shooters opened fire into a crowd on a popular Philadelphia street, police said.
Police Inspector D. F. Pace told local media that two men and a woman had been killed, adding that officers responding to the incident “observed several active shooters shooting into the crowd.”“You can imagine there were hundreds of individuals enjoying South Street, as they do every single weekend when this shooting broke out,” Pace said.
He said that officers had fired at one of the shooters, though it was unclear whether the person was hit.
Local media outlets reported that no arrests had been made.
Pace described the investigation as “fluid,” saying there were still “a lot of unanswered questions.”AFP

headline: CONVENTION: APC must get it right!
summarized_story:
The intrigues surrounding the All Progressives Congress, APC, Convention slated for June 6 and 7, 2022, have generated divergent views among party members and other stakeholders.
The opposition People’s Democratic Party (PDP) is through with its convention, which produced former Vice President Atiku Abubakar as the presidential candidate.
With Atiku as PDP’s standard bearer for the 2023 general elections, the APC must be apt and get its acts right in the selection of a sellable presidential standard bearer.
It could be recalled that President Muhammadu Buhari met with progressive governors to chart a way forward on how to unify the party ahead of the convention.
Based on the research, I came to understand that if APC features Goodluck Jonathan through his track record generally he will dislodge Atiku and the entire PDP.

headline: Men who compete with their babies over breast milk!
summarized_story:
Some years back, when I first learnt of ‘adult nursing’ I was greatly amused.
“Adult nursing” is the term used for men who enjoy being breastfed by a nursing mother!
The thing wasn’t as delicious as I thought.” Now, it seems adult nursing could be a real money spinner.
Carol, a 27-year old single mother who couldn’t afford to pay her rent said, she was introduced to adult nursing by a friend when she hit rock-bottom.
I no longer look down on these men – adult nursing seems a relatively harmless desire.

summarized_story:
Nigeria COVID-19 Action Recovery and Economic Stimulus (NG-CARES) yesterday gave Governor Ifeanyi Ugwuanyi of Enugu State a pat on the back for his administration’s prudent management of public resources in the state.
Ugwuanyi’s administration for observing due process in the management of resources and other administrative engagements.

headline: It’s very sad to leave APGA, Senator Victor Umeh laments after defecting to LP
summarized_story:
Umeh said: “It is very sad to leave APGA because I fought very hard for over 20 years to sustain the party.
I immediately resigned from APGA on 30th of May and joined LP on 31st of May.
“LP is a progressive party and I am happy to be coming from a progressive party into another formidable progressive party.
“Our duty is to follow Peter Obi to campaign in all parts of the country and campaign for LP candidates in Anambra in all the constituencies so that we can win.
I am therefore grateful to His Excellency, Mr. Peter Obi and the national leadership of Labour Party”.

headline: Primaries: SERAP, 185 Nigerians sue INEC over failure to extend voter registration
summarized_story:
Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project (SERAP) and 185 concerned Nigerians have filed a lawsuit against the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC), asking the court to “declare unconstitutional, illegal, and incompatible with international standards the failure of the electoral body to extend the deadline for voter registration to allow eligible Nigerians to exercise their rights.”Against its earlier stance, INEC recently extended the deadline for the conduct of primaries by political parties by six days, from June 3 to June 9.
But the commission has failed to also extend the online pre-registration which ended May 30 2022 and the Continuous Voter Registration (CVR) ending 30 June 2022.
The extension of voter registration would ensure that Nigerian voters are treated equally and fairly.
The future of Nigeria’s democracy depends on it.”SERAP is arguing that, “Voters are also critical stakeholders in the electoral process.
This requires that people should be afforded adequate time and opportunity to register to vote.

headline: Only Buhari can decide if power shifts to South, we only advised – Badaru
summarized_story:
Jigawa State Governor, Badaru Abubakar and one of the All Progressive Congress, APC presidential aspirants have said the Northern Governors are ready to succumb to President Muhammadu’s decision over the plan to give APC presidential ticket to the southern part of the country.
Badaru stated this in an interview with BBC Hausa service on Sunday.
He, however, expressed dismay over some social media reports that the position of Northern governors for the South had been approved, saying it was just a recommendation.
“The truth of the matter, it is just an advice that will be taken to Baba [Buhari], if he agrees to take it if he does not agree then whatever he decides is what we are going to work on it his since we are all Northern Governors are loyal to him,” he said.
“All of us are loyal to him and will not go against his decision”He also said the governors of Kebbi, Plateau and Nasarawa have been assigned to go and advise on our decision”Governor Badaru also debunked reports of his alleged withdrawal from the race, saying he could not withdraw except President Buhari says so.

headline: Former Kwara LP chieftain, Omotosho dies in US, Gov AbdulRazaq mourns
summarized_story:
Kwara State-born politician and the 2015 Governorship candidate of the Labour Party, Dr Mike Omotosho is dead.
Dr Omotosho, who reportedly died in the United States of America, emerged third behind former governor Abdulfatah Ahmed of the APC and Senator Simeon Ajibola of the PDP in the 2015 elections.
In his condolence message, Kwara State Governor AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq described the death of Dr. Mike Omotosho, a former gubernatorial candidate, as painful and shocking.
“My heartfelt condolences go to his aged mother, his immediate family and dependants, and everyone who mourns him.
I beseech Almighty God to repose his soul and comfort the family,” the statement added.

headline: Police demote officer for praising cult group in viral video
summarized_story:
The Nigeria Police Force has announced the demotion of Corporal Isaac Mathew to the rank of Constable.
Mathew, attached to Ebonyi State Police Command, was seen in a viral TikTok video on May 7, 2022.
He was dressed in a Police uniform while singing, dancing and brandishing an AK47 rifle in praise of a secret confraternity.
A statement on Sunday by Force Public Relations Officer, Muyiwa Adejobi announced his sanction.
Inspector-General of Police, Usman Baba has advised all officers to uphold professional ethics, discipline and the ideals of the security agency.

headline: Land Dispute: Osun community raises alarm over Army’s disregard for court order
summarized_story:
The alarm is coming after land owners observed that the Nigerian Army had started the erection of demarcation pillars on the disputed land.
The land owners had dragged the Nigerian Army, Ministry of Defence and others before the court, to seek justice over the land.
“Our families’ quiet possession of the land in dispute was undisturbed until when the defendants invaded the land and allegedly destroyed crops on their family land.
“Apart from the Nigerian Army, there was a rumour of purported acquisition of the land by the community for a proposed company.
“Nigeria Army had turned the land to profit-making, They, therefore, called on the authority concerned to come to their aid,” he lamented.

headline: SERAP, Nigerians sue INEC over failure to extend voter registration
summarized_story:
Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project (SERAP) and 185 Nigerians have filed a lawsuit against the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC).
They want the court to declare the failure of the electoral body to extend the deadline for voter registration unconstitutional.
But the commission did not extend the online pre-registration which ended May 30 2022 and the Continuous Voter Registration (CVR) ending 30 June 2022.
The suit is asking the court for an order to compel INEC to extend voter registration by a minimum of three months.
The suit filed by Kolawole Oluwadare and Opeyemi Owolabi noted that extending the voter registration exercise would further bolster voter confidence in the electoral process.

headline: Buhari extols Kumuyi’s contributions at 81
summarized_story:
President Muhammadu Buhari has lauded the contributions of General-Superintendent of the Deeper Christian Life Ministry, Pastor W. F Kumuyi, to the spiritual and moral development of the country.
Buhari extolled his dedication to soul winning, preaching of the gospel and counselling, the efforts which he said havd led to many changed lives.
“President Muhammadu Buhari joins Christians and Christian leaders all over Nigeria and beyond to celebrate with Founder and General Superintendent of Deeper Christian Life Ministry, Pastor William Folorunso Kumuyi, on his 81st birthday, June 6, 2022.
“President Buhari shares the joy of another age with the octogenarian, his wife, Esther, other family members and friends, while acknowledging the inspiring influence of the many books of the Christian leader, especially the devotionals.
“The President prays that the Almighty God will continue to strengthen Pastor Kumuyi and his family in good health and wisdom,” the statement reads.

headline: APC presidential primary: Tight security around Eagle Square
summarized_story:
Less than 24 hours to the All Progressive Congress (APC) presidential primary, the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) Commissioner of Police (CP) Babaji Sunday has approved massive deployment of officers in and around the city to ensure a hitch-free event.
The Eagle Square, venue of the APC primary, according to the police will also witness tight security.
The deployment, the CP said, is also characterised by heavy visibility policing as would be witnessed at the various traffic control points to aid the free flow of traffic, stop and search, vehicular and foot patrol among many others.
According to a statement on Sunday by the FCT Police Public Relations Officer, DSP Josephine Adeh: “The All Progressive Congress ( APC) Presidential primary election is scheduled to hold from Monday 6th June to Tuesday 7th June 2022 at Eagle’s Square.
The event is often associated with a high influx of different calibers of people especially the politicos thereby requiring an argumentation of the working security architecture of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT)“Given the above, to effectively police the territory within the period in view and beyond, an all-encompassing security deployment has been made”.

summarized_story:

headline: APC presidential primary: Umahi denies stepping down for Lawan
summarized_story:
Ebonyi Governor David Umahi has denied reports that he has withdrawn from the All Progressive Congress (APC) pesidential primary.
He was reacting to reports that he stepped down for Senate President, Ahmed Lawan.
“The Senate President even took out time to eulogize Engineer Umahi for making the Party proud through his purposeful governance in Ebonyi State.

The APC presidential primary holds from June 6th to June 8 2023 in Abuja.

headline: Tambuwal, Deputy pick Sokoto PDP senatorial tickets
summarized_story:
Sokoto Governor Aminu Tambuwal has emerged the People’s Democratic Party (PDP) senatorial candidate for Sokoto South.
He emerged on Saturday night less than 24 hours after he returned to Sokoto after the PDP presidential primary penultimate weekend where he stepped down for former Vice President Atiku Abubakar.
Speaking shortly after declared winner of the primary, Tambuwal said the PDP was poised to win the 2023 general elections.
Tambuwal, who picked the ticket following his unopposed emergence via affirmation, would face Senator Abdullahi Danbaba Dambuwa of the APC who just dumped the PDP.
His Deputy , Muhammad Manir Dan Iya, also clinched Sokoto North senatorial ticket of the party.

summarized_story:

summarized_story:
From Juliana Taiwo-Obalonye, AbujaAhead of the June 6-8 national convention of the All Progressives Congress (APC), President Muhammadu Buhari last night urged presidential aspirants on the party’s platform to hold consultations, and come up with a formidable candidate before the event.

headline: Breaking: Northern APC Govs Want Buhari’s Successor to Come from South
summarized_story:
*Urge northern APC aspirants to withdraw from race•Badaru drops presidential bidAdedayo Akinwale in AbujaThe All Progressives Congress (APC) Northern Governors and party leaders from the north have recommended that President Muhammadu Buhari’s successor should come from the southern part of the country.
The northern governors appealed to all aspirants from the northern states to withdraw in the national interest and allow only the aspirants from the south to proceed to the primaries.
The northern governors noted that this moment calls for the most sober and inclusive approach to selecting the party’s candidate, while calling on all APC leaders to fulfil their responsibility in this regard.
The statement read: “APC governors and political leaders from the northern states of Nigeria today met to review the political situation and to further support our party in providing progressive leadership amidst our national challenges.
“We appeal to all aspirants from the northern states to withdraw in the national interest and allow only the aspirants from the south to proceed to the primaries.”.

headline: Nigeria Police Demote Officer Seen In Viral Video Dancing In Support Of Cult Group
summarized_story:
The Nigeria Police Force has approved the punishment of reduction in rank for Matthew Isaac, a police officer seen in a viral video singing, dancing and brandishing a rifle in praise of a particular confraternity (cult).
This was contained in a statement issued by the Force Public Relations Officer (FPRO), Olumuyiwa Adejobi, who noted that the suspect was attached to the Ebonyi State Police Command.
According to Adejobi, Isaac will be demoted from Corporal to Constable to serve as punishment for the misconduct of the officer.
“Meanwhile, orderly room trials are ongoing and decisions reached at the end of such trials will be made known as the current police administration is committed to a transparent, accountable and proactive policing system in Nigeria.

headline: Teacher arrested in Lagos for ‘raping’ 16-year-old student
summarized_story:
The police in Lagos have detained a school teacher over the alleged rape of a 16-year-old student.
It said the teacher, who coaches the student after school, was said to have had sex with the victim in February 2022.
The agency said the joint task force implementing the Lagos state child protection policy had visited the school.
“The after-school lessons on the school premises were cancelled and the defendant moved the venue for the lessons to his relative’s home.
“DSVA uses this medium to reiterate the state government’s zero-tolerance of all forms of child abuse,” the agency added.

headline: ‘Condom infection’: Court rejects FCT school’s request to halt probe of pupil’s death
summarized_story:
An Abuja court has struck out an application by Premiere Academy Lugbe seeking to stop a probe of the circumstances that led to the alleged rape and death of Keren Akphagher, one of its students.
A report issued to the family by Queen’s Hospital Abuja stated that decomposed condom particles and dead sperm were found in the girl’s vagina.
The house of representatives had also directed that a DNA test be conducted on the male staff at Keren’s school so as to fish out the culprit.
After Keren’s death, Vivien Akphagher, her mother, had lodged a complaint at the Federal Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (FCCPC).
But on Friday, the Abuja federal high court struck the request to halt FCCPC’s investigation into the case.

headline: KWASU student posing as US widow jailed 3 years
summarized_story:
The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) has secured the conviction of a student of Kwara State University (KWASU) Malete.

Sheu was said to have posed as a widow resident in the United States to defraud unsuspecting victims.

In his judgment, Sani pronounced Sheu guilty of the charge and sentenced him to three years imprisonment with the option of a fine in the sum of N982,403.

headline: UI, Oniru beach… Google lists Nigerians most clicked sites in the past year
summarized_story:

AdvertisementThe data, released on Thursday, examined the most clicked beaches, museums, and general points of interest in the country.
According to Google, Oniru Beach Resort in Lagos ranked the most visited beach in Nigeria during the period under review.
The statement also showed the National Museum in Benin city, Edo state, was the most clicked museum in Nigeria in the past year.
AdvertisementA further breakdown showed the most clicked place of interest in the country was the Bariga Waterfront Jetty followed by Nike Art Gallery, and Lekki Conservation Centre respectively.

headline: Founder of Babymigo speaks on reducing maternal deaths in Africa
summarized_story:
Kemi OlawoyeThe role of tech in improving maternal healthcareHA: How big of a role do you think tech can play in improving maternal health in Nigeria?
HA: What singular aspect of maternal healthcare in Nigeria do you think needs the most urgent intervention?
